text: RE: tweaking the animations for the tower in the ZGF office, I would love to explore how hard would it be to give them an interface to “design” their own animations. Could be as simple as a web app running on a RPI with basic tweening controls or something of that sort.
Interesting thought. What do you think an “out of thin air” estimate for something like that might be?
Can’t speak for Miguel’s part but it shouldn’t take more than 1-2 days to do a quick implementation for my side of things.
Cool! That’d be pretty rad.  Before we offer something like that up, we should probably gauge whether we would be down for a small engagement to do it or some form of trade?
Absolutely, I know that for now we want to hear what their creative would like us to do and see it’s going to be a quick update.
Ooh. I didn't realize we'd have one in lobby moving forward. That's awesome.
Selfishly because I also want a controlled environment to shoot in.
And in March we'll be able to shoot 4k
Area idea: we have one in our office
Maybe awful idea, but might a light sculpture look nice above 3rd floor hole? Have ability to be solid continued light vs all animated
Or could be the best idea! Who knows?

<@U0265G76F>: already brainstorming a wall-mounted art piece, and then talked with someone last week who is a glass artist who had played with LEDs inside blown glass tubing. We could partner with a local glass artist to build a piece, then illuminate with a system that could take lighting modes from and Interactive Spaces stack.
I am able to deploy code whenever. Just would be good to get everyone together.
Would give us a chance to show off some of the stuff we’re going to do for BrandLab without having to disclose it.
